description.narrative: AiDx Medical B.V. has developed an affordable alternative to standard microscopic examination by optimally addressing all components of the diagnostic cycle. The AiDx Assist microscope, consists of: 1) a low-cost hardware solution (digital microscope) of high quality optimized for automatic bulk registration of large amounts of disease-specific images such as malaria and 2) Software that is easy to use to scan blood samples and 3) AI-based diagnostic algorithms that eliminate the need for trained experts (fully automatic diagnosis). The automated digital microscopes for screening blood samples have the following advantages: relatively cheap, fast scanning process, high quality, no need for highly skilled experts, build for use in the field, reliable, digital data storage and connection to the network , scalable for a variety of parasitic diseases.There is a lot of malaria in Nigeria (25% of all malaria cases worldwide). Early diagnosis and immediate treatment are two important elements in malaria control. Nigeria is interested in automated malaria detection for fast, cheap and reliable screening of patients, especially because many hospitals cannot offer microscopic examinations for all patients (time-consuming, shortage of highly qualified staff). The AiDx Assist can be used by local health professionals, even in remote rural areas where malaria is high and where there is a great shortage of microscopic examination. The local partner for this project is the West African Postgraduate College of Medical Laboratory Science (WAPCMLS), an organization for private clinics and laboratories in West Africa, which organizes training and conferences for their target group. Demonstration days will be organized here, but there will also be demonstrations at 10 local hospitals and at clinics in rural areas to demonstrate that the device works well under all local conditions.
